title: Use git symbolic-ref for dynamic default branch detection in formulas
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Update mol-refinery-patrol.formula.toml and mol-polecat-work.formula.toml to detect the default branch dynamically using git instead of config.

**Method:**
```bash
git symbolic-ref refs/remotes/origin/HEAD --short | sed 's,.*/,,'
```

**Why git over config:**
- Minimizes configuration changes
- Uses existing git metadata
- Works out of the box for any repo

**Files to update:**
- .beads/formulas/mol-refinery-patrol.formula.toml
- .beads/formulas/mol-polecat-work.formula.toml

Replace all hard-coded 'origin/main' references with dynamic detection.

**Supersedes:** gt-xvo, gt-3je
close_reason: Work complete. Merged via MR gt-638.

title: Research refinery protected branch handling
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Research how the refinery currently handles branch merging and identify gaps for protected branch scenarios.

**Execution**: Use the design formula:
```
gt formula run design --problem="Refinery protected branch handling"
```

**Output**: .designs/<design-id>/ with dimension analyses and synthesized design-doc.md

**Key dimensions to explore**:
- API: GitHub branch protection API requirements
- Data: What protection state to cache/track
- Integration: How detection fits into refinery patrol flow
- Security: Trust boundaries with GitHub API tokens

The design-doc.md will inform subsequent implementation tasks (gt-dkx, gt-0ae, gt-0ug).
close_reason: Research complete: Design documents cover all 4 dimensions (API, Data, Integration, Security). Synthesized design-doc.md ready for implementation tasks gt-dkx and gt-0ae.

title: Re-align gt-5yl design work after default branch updates
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Review and update the mol-refinery-patrol.formula.toml to incorporate protected branch handling.

**Scope**: Update the formula TOML text only. Do NOT modify gastown Go code.

**Context**: 
- gt-4rk added dynamic default branch detection using git symbolic-ref
- gt-5yl researched protected branch requirements

**General Flow**:
1. Detect default branch (via git symbolic-ref)
2. If branch is unprotected → proceed with 'merge & push' onto default branch
3. If branch is protected → create PR instead of direct merge

**PR Tracking**:
Consider including the MR or task ID in the PR (title or body). This allows the refinery to patrol PRs and correlate them back to the originating work item.

**Objective**: Update the refinery formula instructions/steps to:
1. Detect protected branches before attempting merge
2. Handle cases where merge requirements are not met (create PR)
3. Provide clear guidance in formula text for protected branch scenarios

**Output**: Updated mol-refinery-patrol.formula.toml with protected branch handling instructions.
